content: yarn note if you find it difficult to judge whether the foot of your sock is the correct length without being able to try it on you can knit the first few motifs of the foot chart and then place the foot stitches on hold next progress to the picking up your forethought heel instructions on page 9 and work the heel you can then return to the foot instructions and you will be able to try on your sock to check length with this method you should stop knitting the foot chart when you try on the sock and there is approximately 4 5 4 75 5 5 5 5 75 6 25 cm / 1 ¾ 2 2 2 ¼ 2 ¼ 2 ½ between the end of your work and the tip of your big toe finish the foot chart with two mc row and then knit the three-row chart above finish your sock by working the toe instructions 6 @thestitchling toes note you may find the left- and right-leaning decreases video helpful for this section toe set-up remove your bor marker knit 1 k2tog knit 10 12 14 16 18 20 stitches place your bor marker you should have 50 58 66 74 82 90 stitches on your needles place a removable marker 25 29 33 37 41 45 stitches after the bor you now have two options for knitting the toes you can knit a wedge toe which is identical on both socks this is the easiest to knit as it has the least changes in the decrease rate alternatively you can knit a left and right toe these toes mirror each other and are shaped to fit the left and right foot respectively the sample uses the latter option wedge toe left and right toes wedge toe worked the same on both socks note you may find the left- and right-leaning decreases and kitchener stitch videos helpful for this section round 1 knit to the bor round 2 knit 1 ssk knit to three stitches before the first marker k2tog knit 1 sm knit 1 ssk knit to three stitches before the bor k2tog knit 1 repeat rounds 1 and 2 5 6 6 8 8 8 more times you should have 26 30 38 38 46 58 stitches left on your needles work round 2 4 4 5 4 5 7 more times you should have 10 14 18 22 26 30 stitches left on your needles note position your needles so that the first 5 7 9 11 13 15 stitches are on one needle and the last 5 7 9 11 13 15 are on the other hold the needles so that your working yarn is on the right side attached to the furthest right stitch on the back needle cut your yarn leaving a 30 cm / 12 tail graft the toe using kitchener stitch 7 @thestitchling right toe note you may
